page.title: 20FINAL THOUGHTS
page.content: The rugged moorland and the China Clay Industry dominate this area.The smaller settlement of Whitemoor is slowly dying as young people leave for employment or to marry.The larger settlement of Roche is expanding with new housing developments. Low cloud, fog and rain on the hills stay for days, resulting in a cold, gloomy landscape. The weather in St. Austell 5km away may be fine and sunny. On a clear, fine day the views are spectacular and nature comes alive. The pupils of Whitemoor C.P.School have compiled this project with the help of their teacher, Mrs. Olford and local resident and school governor, Mrs. Billing. Nicholas Stuthridge, aged 11 years wrote "Sunday in Whitemoor".
